Review.Titre: Bought one of the new Nightwave cameras…
Review.Contenu: Bought one of the new Nightwave cameras and I was excited to see its performance. Shortly after mounting and deciding to move it to another location on the boat, I discovered that water was leaking into the base. I snapped the base back on as instructed and poured water over the top for a short time, and removed base to verify. Water was again present so it’s obvious there is an issue. I contacted Sionyx and advised them of the problem and was told I would be provided a return label for it to be repaired. After a couple days after not receiving the return label, I contacted them again and was told it would be coming soon. After 10 days and 2 more contacts I am still getting the runaround. I then contacted the dealer I bought it from, they also contacted  Sionyx, and they appear to be getting the same delays. I have now requested a replacement as I am concerned that if I get the same delays once they finally receive it, it may be months before I get it back. It’s unfortunate, because this may be a great product in the end, but they need to seriously look at the procedures if they expect to survive. Hopefully they will finally make this right.

Review.Contenu: Never shipped my items, not sure what the deal is. Finally ended up asking for a refund. Communication has been good, just the shipping department has been such a huge let down. Never buying from here again.

Review.Titre: Poor connectivity.
This is scammy and misleading.
Review.Contenu: Ok, I don't like to leave bad reviews needlessly, but this is too much. I bought a Pro model several weeks ago to use as a night scope for pigs on some property I own. The first and most misleading statement is that this is "full color" night vision. Put simply it's not at all full color. It's slightly colorized. The thing that pushed me over the edge to finally buy it is that the needlessly expensive rail mount and illuminator were included for free as part of a March Madness sale. Here's the second problem. You have to fill out some rebate form which isn't something that is just there for you to fill out. You have to seek it out. This is clearly so you'll put it off and forget about it. Well I didn't forget. Then they tell you you'll get your stuff in ~6 weeks. I got the extras today, and the rail that they sell for FIFTY DOLLARS  is the male side of a picatinny. You can't attach it to a standard rail on its own. It's 100% useless. What they have pictured on their site is the appropriate set up, but that's not what you'll receive, so now you'll have to buy some other adapter to actually be able to mount it to a rifle. I want to return this. I don't even want it anymore. There are cheaper better alternatives out there. PLEASE do not give this company your money. I also want to point out I'm not some grouchy old man that doesn't know how things work. I'm 30, and I have a pretty good grasp on reality. I promise you don't want this thing for 1000 dollars. Oh also, their app is riddled with connectivity issues. I have the newest iPhone, so I really doubt it's on the phone's side. I actually took pictures of how silly this set up is, but there's not an option to upload them here. Furthermore, their return policy is good for 14 days, which is about 4 weeks short of how long it actually took them to send me the second portion of my order. They also graciously stick you with a 15 percent restocking fee. You know because it costs more to put the pro model back on the shelf than it would the cheaper ones, and then they even allow you to pay the return shipping on a product you're not happy with, so I've basically tossed ~200 bucks now for literally nothing. I'm really really disappointed in this transaction and product top to bottom.Edit: I will give them credit where it is due. They did not hold me to the 15% restocking fee. They did however stick me with the return shipping since I was having "buyer's remorse" as he put it rather than the product being underwhelming. I still would never recommend this product to anyone, but I do appreciate the refund, and I do think they were as helpful as one could expect all things considered.

Review.Contenu: I purchased a Sionyx Black deal in late October. It was real expensive but they had a rebate program running and I took the plunge. The unit has a small FOV but the results were still pretty impressive and I wasn't sorry for the purchase. About 3 days after I received the device my wife was diagnosed with breast cancer. When things settled down just a bit and I remembered about the rebate it had ended the week before. I contacted the company and asked for a little leeway on the date. No reply at all. Mind you, they contacted me daily during the period I was considering purchasing it. They were very responsive to sell the things, no so much after that. I would give the device 3 stars, mostly due to the short battery time and difficulty of charging the second battery. i give the company 1 star for pure greed and lack of compassion. Knowing what I now know about them and my current financial situation, I would not make this purchase again. Sure could have used that rebate

Review.Titre: Not As Promised for PI's
Review.Contenu: If you want a great full color night vision camera for your gun or as a hobbyist - I highly recommend this product BUT if you are a PI, Security Specialist, Law Enforcement of any kind or similar professional PLEASE CONSIDER YOUR OPTIONS. Sionyx makes claims that it offers a date/time stamp. This is misleading. Sionyx actually has a one time non-visible date and time creation stamp embedded in its hidden metadata. NOT A VISIBLE OR CONTINUOUS OVERLAY OF THE DATE/TIME. Therefore, if you just want see better at night - it works. BUT if you need to create court friendly evidence by video documenting at night - prepare to have your butt handed to you in court. Easy to manipulate the record that is hard to show. Easy to edit the evidence without proof of tampering. Easy to get your evidence thrown out of court. Sadly, Sionyx customer service is terrible and unsympathetic stating only that they "have no plans" to correct or improve this issue. As a result, a 5 star product earns my 2 star review because the company continues to market itself to law enforcement types knowing that it isn't providing what the industry requires. That being said, if I can find a work around to make the videos taken court-ready, I would buy more of their units. But as it stands - it's a pretty toy - not a game changer.

Review.Titre: Connection to the app should be better
Great product for the price range.
Some Good, a little bit of strange
Review.Contenu: I bought an original Aurora with the pre-holiday sale.  There was something weird with my card, and I finest you all about it - the responses were prompt and professional.  The camera was shipped quickly and arrived promptly - good stuff.  Even dealing with the rebate and illuminator taking awhile to ship, Justin was responsive and helpful. Again, great customer service.The bad?  I was sent a survey shortly after getting my camera.  In that survey I let y'all know that it was kind of obnoxious to keep the Pro model unavailable through the holiday sale, only to make it available for purchase pretty much immediately after the "holiday sale" ended.  I can guess at why you folks did this - clear out the stock on products there's going to be much much less interest in as soon as the Pro is available - from the consumer end, it was a frustrating move.  I, like many others, would have skipped the holiday sale and just gotten the pro had you made it available before the holidays.But what was particularly unprofessional was the response I got from William, who seemed personally offended by my feedback.   Through a series of emails, he offered to "buy back" my camera if I wasn't happy with it.  It was like pulling teeth over the course of something like 8 emails back and forth to get the details of what this "offer" actually was (he neglected answering my really straightforward questions to clarify what was being offered through multiple emails) - he didn't mean a return and then an exchange/refund - Will meant I would send my camera back to be assessed by him, and he would then pay some amount to be determined based upon inspection that I could then apply towards a Pro.It would have been better of William had just taken my criticism as helpful customer feedback - I was fine with my purchase, just a little put off by having bought a product that was almost instantly no longer top-shelf.  Instead we had this bizarre exchange that left me questioning whether I'd want to deal with, or recommend you folks again.  If Will was going respond and offer something, the customer friendly response would have been to offer an immediate exchange and send me the invoice to pay the difference in cost FYI. Not responding would have been just fine too, and then all I'd remember were the good interactions.

Review.Titre: Aurora not-so-Pro
Review.Contenu: Overall this product was a disappointment for the money spent and there was clearly a lack of attention put into human engineering or operational application.  It does have good color night vision and functions as described in that regard.  The images are also far sharper than any image intensifier based device.  While the image quality is good, the night/twilight/day selector is small and difficult to manipulate even without gloves, and the lens adjustment is easily bumped out of position when attempting to adjust the N/T/D switch.  This is definitely below par for hunting or tactical use due to the direction arrow controls being so small, making them difficult to manipulate when wearing all but nitrile gloves or perhaps tight fitting pilot’s gloves.  Typical Nomex gloves or Mechanix type protective gloves will make this problem worse.  It is also a sound and light discipline disaster, due to readily visible green and red LED’s on initial startup, combined with a zingy noise.  You shouldn’t have to be an operator to realize this; any hunter or surveillance specialist will pick this out as a problem immediately. This will give away your position day or night so attempting to use this for law enforcement, security, or military surveillance is a mission failure waiting to happen.  These should be disabled from the start and require a menu selection to enable them.  Another point of failure is loading and unloading the battery.  The rear end has to be removed and has no retaining cord, strap, or cable.  If you were attempting to change batteries in a moving vehicle or during a high stress situation, this could easily get away from you, possibly putting your NVD out of action.  The release lever for the end cap / battery access is also very difficult to operate when you are wearing gloves, probably impossible for someone with big fingers plus gloves.  The “instructions” are a flimsy folded piece of paper with tiny printing that is difficult to read in all but bright light conditions.  For the amount of money this cost I’m irritated that Sionyx couldn’t provide an instructional CD or mini-disc with a PDF instruction manual, let alone print a proper instruction booklet, even in black and white.  I’ve paid less for other NVD’s and IR/visible lasers that come with a paper manual that provides more information in a format that doesn’t require magnifiers to read comfortably. It also wouldn’t have cost the manufacturer too much to throw in one of the Picatinny mounts with the package deal, especially since another manufacturer sells 3 different heights for $1 more.  Next time, Sionyx, please do better research and look at some mil-spec gear to avoid the problems inherent to the Aurora not-so-pro.

Review.Titre: I’ve had the aurora pro for about a…year
Review.Contenu: I’ve had the aurora pro for about a year.  This nvg is actually pretty amazing.  Works well in low light, works well with illuminator, does a commendable job of trying to convert the dark into correct chromatic color.  I gave it 4 stars because for this scope to make the leap it needs within the market it needs 2 things.  First a digitally adjustable sight reticle as found on the ATN products.  Second, the eye relief/focal point needs to be increased so that the eye doesn’t have to be so close to the display.  This would allow for recoil with a black eye.  SiOnyx has done a great job with this scope but these two features will greatly enhance the scope’s use ability for the hunting market.

Review.Titre: True night vision?
Review.Contenu: Ok so first off true night vision? No, will you get green eye using it? Also no, however a swivel mount is essential as you will get black eye, how long that takes depends on how high the brightness has been tuned. I'm hoping to purchase a few more battery packs, as the charge time is unclear, and battery life out of the box is likely not 8hrs, if charging for 5 hours(out the box) doesn't charge the battery to full. In complete darkness this device is extremely risky, and should not be used, stick to your PVS14s, however if a (IR or otherwise) illuminator can be used safely I highly recommend this device. Rifle mounted this device performs admirably, in conjunction with a zeroed PEQ15 it can replace your day sight and will basically be a laser, however again the context is LUME, no lume you have to use your flood or another light source, generally speaking great device, however there are shortcomings, however this device is great fun, and I look forward to teaching about it this weekend. I think this is a great hunting tool, as long as it's paired with a IR laser and flood.The key issue I'm having is mounting options and charge time, the mounting process to helmet isn't clear and I've sent an email, hope to hear from them soon. I bought this for personal use, I bought it to product test and introduce it to other service members, and teach about this specific product at my unit, I am in the military, and I am in no way endorsed or affiliated with Sionyx.

I really do like this camera and the accessories so I give it 4 stars.

Review.Titre: The communications started well but…
Review.Contenu: The communications started well but became confusing.  There was a wait for clearance through customs, but this apparently cleared early, and then I was asked for feedback without yet receiving the product.  On you website to download documents, a popup tells you to click the link below to download the PDF.  There is/was no link provided, so testing in the field required a cell/WiFi connection.  A more controlled supply chain and communications would up your star level.

Review.Titre: Bought the Pro
Review.Contenu: Have the Pro and camera is great.  Night vision is incredible.  However, the user manual lacks full information and you have to hunt to assemble the full knowledge base.  Customer service is lacking too.  The take home from me is the product is phenomenal, but be prepared to be on your own.

Review.Titre: Nice unit just wish it had a lens cap…
Review.Contenu: Nice unit just wish it had a lens cap and it took regular batteries. But besides that it’s nice seeing things In color a bit nicer than green. Nice and light the more ambient light the better or and infrared light just like a night scope would need , adjust the gain for a better pic to get rid of some grain in the screen. The unit i feel for the price is just as good as my gen 2 that I have

Review.Titre: What a game changer for night time…
Review.Contenu: What a game changer for night time navigation.  This unit performs better than advertised, after 20yeary of experience with Anvis devices I had my reservations.  I am truly satisfied with the product but wish mine w would have come with the Ir light as my brothers did.  It make a great improvement.Jeff

Review.Titre: This is my first intro to any type of…
Review.Contenu: This is my first intro to any type of night vision and I have to say I am happy with my purchase so far. It has met all my expectations to this point. Being I have only limited experience, I am giving it a 4 star. If it holds up and continues to perform as expected, I will come back and up it to 5.

Review.Titre: Great night vision for boating
Review.Contenu: It would have been nice to see on your website a comparative table between the different models. We bought the sport which doesn’t even come with a manual or memory card! After downloading the manual and seeing other models features we may have upgraded. But we are happy with the sport. Would be nice if we could purchase extra batteries. Impressive sight at night for sure!

Review.Titre: A few bugs but overall amazing product
Review.Contenu: I have the original model and the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is the bugs on the app. I finally figured out that other wifi sources interfere with the initial connection, so it works out in the woods but not at home. I would suggest that you guys release an adapter to replace the viewfinder module with a live HDMI out, that would really increase the versatility of the system for weapon or vehicle mounted use.

Review.Titre: I am thrilled with the quality of the…
Review.Contenu: I am thrilled with the quality of the images at night under ambient, night light conditions.  I am not as thrilled with the iphone interface.  I have had problems downloading a video taken on the SiOnyx to my phone.  It starts the download and just quits 2/3 of the way done.  I know I can pull the micro SD card and do a manual download, but it should work via the iphone interface.  Also, I've barely had the unit for a month and the SIONYX label is curling up and coming off the case.  The adhesive should not be failing like this...happy to send photos.

Review.Titre: I probably would have given 5 stars…
Review.Contenu: I probably would have given 5 stars except for the lack of accessories for mounting the camera on anything other than a tripod (no they don't supply that either).  Many of the videos they show are of folks using them on firearms or head mounted for hands free operation.  After contacting them they stated they do no sell accessories and could not provide any information for anyone that does.  Other than that the camera itself is quite amazing and I would recommend this to anyone.

Review.Titre: The rail mount is pretty good
Review.Contenu: The rail mount is funtional, only issue with it may have been an overlook in development, but you need to remove the mount to access the tab to remove the battery pack.  Not a big deal unless you plan on staying out and having to change batteries in the middle of the night

Review.Titre: Cool product but not as advertised
Review.Contenu: Shopping and purchase went well. No instructions with the product. Needed to go. In website to learn features and limits. I had a 64gb micro and card at home. It would not function in the camera. Found out online that it would only hold a max 32 GB card. Easy to use. Image quality less than advertised.

Review.Titre: Smooth Order, Fast Delivery, Some Fixes Would Make Excellence
Review.Contenu: Excellent ordering experience, appreciated various payment options. From order to delivery extremely fast! The device is great and well made - it would be helpful to have a quick start guide in the box even if it directs you to website - for example here is how to insert battery and charge it should be in the box. Also a recommendation on the microSD card prior to delivery would also be good. Finally I didn't see it on SiOnyx site but are there eyecups and lens covers available? If not should look at that accessory.

Review.Titre: Very efficient site
Review.Contenu: Very efficient site,  fast purchase,  goods under testing.  Not 5 stars since 1) i had to pay the customs on my own,  that's ok,  but I didn't read anything about it ( in italy is 22%) 2) the item has arrived with two invoices that has generated some trouble in customs 3) the item ( aurora pro)  comes without any manual,  but i have to say I found the aurora mamual in this site. Overall,  a good buying experience. As stated before the site is ok ( and the italian translation quite good compared to the average translated sites)

Review.Titre: For an entry level camera, it works…
Review.Contenu: For an entry level camera it works well. I would have hoped for some lense covers, eye cup, and portable battery charger but I can make due for now. The picatinny rail adapter is quite bulky and heavy for the price. I would have expected a little more refined mount.

Review.Titre: Excellent product, minus 1080p resolution
Review.Contenu: After waiting since July 2020 to receive my gear, I finally got it on Saturday and Wow! Straight out of the box performance after charging the battery. Tried it at dusk and then at 10pm and crystal clear visibility out to well over 100yds. Excited to try it on a FM-9, AR-15. I’m wondering if it will work on a suppressed AR-10?? Only reason I gave it still a 4-Star is no 1080p resolution and it took so long to receive. I will give them some slack due to COVID. So only mark down would be for the 1080p. Recommend buy these while you can for the price point and quality, can’t beat it!!!

Review.Titre: Bringing color to the night.
Review.Contenu: I'm just beginning to learn about the Aurora Black and there's lots to learn.I'm most pleased by the customer service.  My questions were answered promptly and there is a wealth of info online!  I look forward to exploring the night with this very good tool.

Review.Titre: Overall great product for the money
Review.Contenu: Overall great product for the money.  Only issue I have had so far was the lack of instructions.  They gave me 16 different pamphlets in 26 different languages written in legalese about safety this and that, but nothing on how to operate the thing.

Review.Titre: Great product
Review.Contenu: Great product, wish it came with lens covers and carrying case.A huge help in boating early morning to the fishing grounds.Mounted to my boat using a suction cup camera mount and stream to my Samsung tablet through wifi. Great image stabilization!

Review.Titre: Aurora…
Review.Contenu: I initially wanted to finance my Aurora through Klarma, however, it would not allow me to on the site so I ended up buying it outright which is quite expensive. The item shipped the next day so that was nice to see. Overall, no complaints.

Review.Titre: Bought for my son who lives in America…
Review.Contenu: Bought for my son who lives in America and I live in England had problems with payment card but once this was resolved delivered on time and my son used on his boat and said it does everything it said in the advert,  well pleased.

Review.Titre: I'm very happy with my purchase
Review.Contenu: I'm very happy with my purchase. Really easy to use and works better than I expected. Only improvement I would like to see, is shipping. And I know that is be on your control. But the USPS has gone to s__t.

Review.Titre: Great service and a well made product
Review.Contenu: Great service and a well made product.  I really like how it can be linked to a smartphone or tablet.  However, I wish there was a way to get it to display a split-screen image so it could be used with a virtual reality headset.

Review.Titre: Issues with breakage but resolved. Quality footage and sound
Review.Contenu: I purchased an Aurora in December of 2018, in December of 2019 it sustained a 2 foot fall resulting in the objective portion separating and breaking. the initial CS offer was less than satisfactory given that the unit was still under warranty. After speaking to the VP of marketing, the issue was resolved to my satisfaction and I definitely got the impression that he wants to improve the product. The camera itself is amazing, especially for the price. While not PVS-14 gen 3 quality, it’s still well worth the price. I highly recommend having an IR source when shooting on moonless nights. The resolution is definitely HD and the sound quality on recorded footage is solid.

Review.Titre: Excellent construction!
Review.Contenu: Excellent construction for the camera! It is solid and well built.The iOS phone app needs more work. It crashed several time, especially when linked via WiFi. Lately, it is difficult to turn on and off time lapse.

Review.Titre: Awesome
Review.Contenu: I really like the products offered. A good friend/coworker bought the sport model and wow great product. I also like that Sionyx is with GovX thank you for supporting our Active Duty service men and women and veterans.

Review.Titre: The camera is superb in quality and capabilities
Review.Contenu: The camera is superb in quality and capabilities, well constructed and can be used versatilely for many applications.  The tablet and phone App only works with a limited number of tablets and phone models.

Review.Titre: For the price
Review.Contenu: For the price, should come with cover for the lens like expensive cameras. And give recommendations where to buy attachments for mounting. Takes good videos/pictures day or night, but for price expected better quality.

Review.Titre: I found the Sionyx PRO unit to preform well
Review.Contenu: I found the Sionyx PRO unit to preform very well for lighted areas by moonlight and ambient light sources and has the similar attributes as a GEN 2 as advertised.  I bought it for star watching and for that it does extremely well as you can snap pictures or video of stars that you cannot see with the naked eye and it is a very compact/lightweight.  With a new moon i.e.(no moon) it is difficult but not impossible to see in totally dark situations but I expected that. Overall for the cost the unit serves as a good NV and as a bonus the NV does work very well with AIMPOINT or EOTECH or other similar laser projection gunsights with the Sionyx picatinny rail system which is a very well made metal quick mount option. The case is sturdy and the unit charges appropriately.  No complaints at this time.

Review.Titre: Nice little unit
Review.Contenu: I would have liked written directions included in the package.  Otherwise I'm pretty happy with the camera.  I will be purchasing a ir lamp for my boat for improved visibility.

Review.Titre: Quick service
Review.Contenu: Quick service. Fast shipping. Product works as stated. Have not had much of a chance to use it yet but so far it seems good. Cant wait to get more time with it at night.

Review.Contenu: Easy to operate and functions are easy to learn.Limited zoom.Lots of noise in limited light. Great battery life for its intended use. Do wish it was twice as long though.

Review.Titre: Excellent customer service from Bill…
Review.Contenu: Excellent customer service from Bill who responded quickly to answer all questions and assisted in confirming my March Madness Promo code was completed. Bill was also able to answer a technical question regarding cowitness height when the Pro is mounted on the optional picatinny rail as 1.5" which makes it halfway between typical absolute cowitness height and 1/3 cowitness height. The only reason for four stars is inability to get basic information from the website where user manuals would not drop in pdf format and could only access information in a small site pop-out window. I also had an issue confirming that the site processed my March Madness because the form would only reset on submission without providing any confirmation however Bill was again very quick to confirm after contacting him. I recommend to utilize site email tool for any questions.Purchased the Pro out of curiosity with plan to eventually invest in thermal/3P equipment, maybe this will allow SIONYX to further develop the Aurora (hunting/tactical applications) and challenge these more expensive technologies and extend battery life.

Review.Titre: I bought two Aurora Black new. One off EBay and another from Amazon.
Review.Contenu: I bought one Aurora Black new off EBay then a second via Amazon. The second units image quality is noticeably darker.  The second also does not have the " turn the camera on before attaching a external battery issue".  I was hoping updating the firmware would fix the first (older) camera. But no, it did not. I would happily give five stars I could fix the external battery bug without buying a another camera. I upgraded my external battery to a Anker PowerCore 13000. With the latest Aurora Black, I can leave it attached to battery. No need to disconnect. The Anker turns on when the Auroura is switch on. With a UGREEN  1.5 ft. USB cable and a Duttek Micro USB splitter cable, the installation on a bump helmet with cover is super clean because I was able to thread the cable (with a little effort) through the webbing loops and re-lace the elastic bungee cord . Also, the splitter allows me to disconnect the cameras and remove the whole unit from the helmet without disturbing the rest of the cable assembly. Hopefully, Sionyx will include the external battery on / off - plug / unplug fix in the next update. I am proof they have it.

It is an amazing monocular, I can see clearly in almost complete darkness. without the unit I can not see anything. So, as-far as the unit functioning, it does what they say it will. My issue and biggest complaint is i wanted to use this as a tactical helmet mounted monocular, I have backup battery ready to go and purchasing an IR illuminator. BUT cant use any of that because I'm having to figure some crazy way of connecting the night vision to my helmet. Its SO disappointing that I have to jump through hoops ordering connection pieces from 3 different manufactures and from Great Britain at a HUGE cost just to mount the thing to my helmet...this is ridiculous.The checkout process was good and the 4 pay by Klarna was very helpful. I contacted support about the 100$ rebate and they are processing that as well. I just wish there was a suitable easy connection system for my helmet or rifle. I'm not happy that the connection system with all needed parts are gonna cost as much as the Aurora itself, once its all said and done... For that I could have just went ahead and bought the PVS-14 Gen 2

Review.Titre: The product arrived in plenty of time…
Review.Contenu: The product arrived in plenty of time after ordering. The case that it was shipped in is a very robust pelican type case that is very durable and is great protection for the product. The contents were fully intact and well protected. Upon opening the case, I was disappointed that there were no product description/operating instructions. Even military systems like this come with operating instructions. I had to go to the product website to download instructions.  Once I had downloaded the operating instructions, it was fairly simple to get the device up and running once the batteries were charged.  After loading the mini card to set up the device, it was just a matter of going through the different operating modes and set them all up. This was not a bad process.  1. The daylight mode was decent, as one would expect. I did notice a bit of lag while moving the device from at a medium motion side to side. Upon mounting it to my m4, (I also purchased the mount), the picatinny rails fit nicely with no excessive movement. We fired 5 rounds and observed there was just a bit of “bounce or jarring”, probably due to the recoil of the rifle. 2. During dusk and night operations the device, (aurora), was able to easily acquire targets at 100yds. Again, the “bounce” was noticed during firing. At complete darkness, a scintillating effect was notice even after adjusting the forward and aft focusing features. A scintillating sight picture was observed at 100yds. This was cleared up much better with an IR light. When using an IR light/laser device we observed that there was a loss of the color feature of the device. We used streamlight and surefire IR laser/light systems. It was observed that we were not as accurate at 100yds while using the device at full darkness. Synopsis: The device is worth the price but it does have a learning curve to properly use it. The fact that there are no operating instructions when it was received is disappointing. The company is not very specific on the ability to attach this to a helmet or a headband device.  All and all this device will work for individuals looking to acquire a good night vision device.

Review.Titre: Service was good
A solid choice in night vision
Review.Contenu: Having never tried Digital night vision i was apprehensive. I saw the OPSIN and immediately got excited. I ordered and have been extremely pleased in my 100hrs of operating the system. I will continued to do business

Review.Titre: Nightwave is the real deal!!
Review.Contenu: Seeing is believing (pun intended) & their new Nightwave marine cam is the real deal. Was pretty blown away with how much detail it was picking up in tight quarters when docking. Around the docks in the marina, rocks when lobstering around the jetties, or navigating home offshore at night - the Nightwave makes life easier. I’m a huge fan of redundancies & tech that makes fishing/boating safer and that’s what this product does. And at a much much more affordable cost than other competitors. Big fan!

Review.Titre: The Sionyx Nightwave camera is a MUST HAVE!
Review.Contenu: The Sionyx Nightwave camera is an absolute game-changer! The picture comes in crisp with low-to-no light while running offshore or through the intracoastal. Connecting the camera to my phone is a breeze- I'm looking forward to permanently installing the unit on my boat. You truly can't beat the quality of this product at this price point.

Review.Titre: Sionyx Nightwave D1
Review.Contenu: Great product, quick shipping and knowledgeable staff.  Installing the unit on our Fountain for our family trip to the Dry Tortugas/Fort Jefferson.  It is a much needed upgrade for night time/overnight trips like this one.

Review.Titre: Incredibly useful for boating
Review.Contenu: Finally had a chance to acid-test the thing: cloudy night over the water, pitch black out to naked eye - though horizon lights around my bay and far-off city light haze provide a bit of illumination; color night mode test for boating use.  I'm absolutely stunned by the detail observed - can clearly distinguish rocks, floating debris/logs, waves.  Not even using the IR illuminator!  Compare iPhone XS:  black screen.

Review.Titre: excellent Process
Review.Contenu: The purchase process was straight forward and easy. The payment process was quick and secure. The shipping was quick. the packaging was secure.The product is solid, sturdy, tactile, easy functions and capable. I'm still waiting for the extra battery pack that was promised with the purchase. I am told it takes 6-8 weeks for the extra battery pack to be delivered. however, overall ecperice is excellent.

Review.Titre: Great device, great Customer Service...
Review.Contenu: Their camera just wasn't right for my oldest son (an avoid hunter), so SIONIX accepted my return without question, full refund! If you're monitoring someone, say an FBI agent or other agency (DEA/DHS/Border Security, PI) THIS is your best way to go. The Head of Customer Care - Night Vision Camera Systems (Bill Bobrowski) , was all over the whole refund process. He also shipped the device very quickly. If ever I need something like this, I will definitely be back. Would recommend it! IF it had night/thermal capability, I might've kept it for myself...

Review.Titre: EXCEEDS MY EXPECTATIONS!
Review.Contenu: I thought the free Illuminator was a fake simply because of the price of it. But I got the free Illuminator as advertised in FB. I've enjoyed going outdoor night walks ever since. It's just the start, future plans will be photography of the wild and some night hunting. Aurora PRO exceeds my expectations, I walked around the dark areas of our neighborhood, and I can see clearly in details my sorroundings as if I have used a very large white bright spotlight.

Review.Titre: AlohA
Review.Contenu: AlohAI neva fill out these kind of surveys but I feel compelled to do so with this one. I had a minor disappointment when I received the Explorer Pro kit and I emailed it to Justin Johnson and he must have ran it up the chain of command because the next thing I know I'm receiving a UPS delivery of an extra, not included assembly at No Charge, at my office. The equipment and technology is incredible as my brother Rick recommended you and your service with a smile is old school and you now have a customer for life!MahalOzFrancis B. (MacK) McClelland

Review.Titre: Outstanding customer service and support
Review.Contenu: Bought the Aurora Pro Kit and was missing a mount for the IR illuminator. Emailed the company and got a response within minutes from customer service. Explained my issue, they had the missing part shipped within 24 hours. Also assisted me with set up of the camera through their video library. They did all of this over the July 4th Holiday weekend. Outstanding customer service by Bill Bobrowski. Will buy from SIONYX again in the future! Best customer service I've ever experienced on any product. Camera is fantastic and does everything advertised! Great value for Night Vision product. Would recommend Aurora Pro to anyone.

Review.Titre: The buying process was amazingly easy!
Review.Contenu: The buying process was amazingly easy.  There was a hiccup that occurred when I received the email that said the camera had shipped, yet when I put in the tracking number in, UPS/FedEx (I forget who), said they hadn’t received the package yet???  I sent an email asking about that and received a response within a few minutes, which impressed me beyond words!The camera arrived a week later!

Review.Titre: EXTREME VALUE achieving color digital night vision in compact elegant design
Review.Contenu: Currently very early on with my testing/evaluation. But so far i am extremely impressed with the device. Top notch protective waterproof case. Very compact very elegant design. I love the digital enhancements with a sharp color image... far nicer than my $3k conventional NVG, and way sharper than my $3k thermal imager (but of course not having that special capability). i only had time for a quick eval around my yard, and i am very favorably impressed. i call it an extreme value for the price. Have not yet tested the IR illuminator, but i have had good results from using a different one with my conventional NVG.

Review.Titre: It works
Review.Contenu: It works, like surprisingly well.  If its a new moon out and cloudy it wont be very effective without some illumination.  If its anything greater than a new moon (even when its cloudy) I can see 3 or 400 yards into my property clear enough to make out facial features.The only thing i'd improve is making one with a reticle...

Review.Titre: Make the investment!
Review.Contenu: Talk about quick shipping and ZERO hassle. ABSOLUTELY ZERO! Cannot wait to use this on some live fire courses but also utilize it on camping and night boating trips. It's versatility in different applications was the selling point and the ability to record was a definite plus. Thank you to the TEAM at Sionyx! -J.R.

Review.Titre: Didn't expect a fast delivery even as…
Review.Contenu: Didn't expect a fast delivery even as remotely hidden in Fairbanks Alaska. Usually I see deliveries beyond 10 ten days. And at minus 10 degrees today camera was able to come on. Will be looking forward to the days and will use the camera more. Glad I responded to the ad. Sincerely; John G.

Review.Titre: Installing Nightwave was easy
Review.Contenu: Installing Nightwave was relatively easy. It took about 4 hours for my buddy and I to install and if plugged right into my MFD (Simrad) no problems. The camera has been great to use. We have a long way to our fishing grounds in my backyard and we leave before the sun comes out and often fish at night. The image is really good and it has a very wide view. I love it so far!

Review.Titre: Excellent customer service
Review.Contenu: I experienced some charging difficulties, and wasn't sure if it was the camera, batteries, cord, power source, or just me.  I contacted Sionyx customer service, and was surprised at the quick response I received from Bill.  He offered advice on troubleshooting my problem and sent me a return authorization to have my equipment checked out.  Prompt, professional and helpful experience from beginning to end.  It's so nice to have a company stand behind their product!  Thank you Bill, thank you Sionyx!

Review.Titre: Great product, and better customer service

Review.Titre: Outstanding customer care
Review.Contenu: I recently experienced a minor issue with my Aurora camera after years of flawless functioning.  I was absolutely blown away by the level of support I received from initial contact to resolution.  I sent an email describing the problem to customer service and received a reply within a couple of hours.  Bill Bobrowski told me to send the camera in and they’d have a look at it.  The same morning they got the camera, they had my issue resolved and my camera was on the way back, arriving two days later.  All my questions were answered quickly and in a friendly, professional manner.  This is without any doubt the best customer service I’ve experienced anywhere.

Review.Titre: Good unit but not fully functional
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately I have been unable to get the wifi feature to work.  After a series of emailed suggestions that I followed meticulously, it still refuses to pair with my iPhone. They suggested a Zoom call but I don't want to load that software on my devices so it appears I'm stuck with a partly-operational unit. Disappointing. I was very pleased that the CS manager got back to me quickly by email and chat to assure me that I understood the offer correctly. Possibly related to my computer's security configuration but I had a bit of trouble trying to email for advice. Not a big deal, I simply put my email address in a chat message and it was picked up and put to use in the best way. I'm looking forward to my Sionyx NV device with the free illuminator which you shipped today. That is a SUPER deal! Thanks!

Review.Titre: Aurora Pro Has Amazing Clarity, Very Surprised!
Review.Contenu: Honestly didn’t expect this to be all that great, knowing up front is is best during partial moon.  The night it arrived there wasn’t any moon showing and as expected it needed the IR light, but wow it was clear.  The next night I was able to get out during twilight, and could only see about 100’ with my own eyes.  When I put this on twilight and night mode and WOW could I see with now help from the IR light, way into the tree line over 100 yards (not feet).  I am so glad I took the plunge on buying this, and that it wasn’t a frivolous purchase.  BTW I own high end NVG and am always concerned about burning the intensifier in urban or street lit settings.  This fits the bill perfectly with no risk to the device.  Oh and the added memory size is a huge help Inwasnt aware of during purchase.

Review.Contenu: SIONYX makes a very cool night vision monocular. I liked my first one so much that i immediately bought a 2nd one. And the customer service is super-fast. I mean, really really fast. I got an email response within a few minutes and my package was ready to delivery by 3 am. Awesome!

Review.Titre: Buying an Aurora through SiOnyx is…
Review.Contenu: Buying an Aurora through SiOnyx is easier and less complicated than trying to buy it through a reseller(like Amazon). Resellers have restrictions on where the product is sent. Not so with SiOnyx. The only concern I had, was with the shipper they chose. First notification, on day of delivery, stated I could expect delivery between 1:00 & 3:00 pm. Then, after 3:00 came and went, the update stated the delivery would be before 7:00 pm. Aurora was finally delivered close to 6:00 pm. The last time I had a delivery by this shipper, I got the same messages, only to find out they had put the package on the wrong truck. I’m not holding SiOnyx responsible for this, but they might want to use a more reliable shipper, like FedEx or the US Postal Service. The product however has exceeded initial expectations and further testing needs to be conducted.

Review.Titre: SiOnyx Pro is a great little package-wishlist manual zoom
Review.Contenu: SiOnyx Pro is a great little package. Will be using this camera for hiking and outdoors surveillance at night. After the first few trials in my backyard I am beyond pleased with its performance. Digital zoom is a little up for discussion, I would rather see a true mechanical zoom on this even if it was 2x or up to 4X max then use digital zoom for up to 8X. I know it would add weight and size but I think it would keep the resolution a little higher. The optional IR illumination kit is no joke and really fills in the room when used indoors, spot focus is read well on the SiOnyx outdoors as a spot light. App interface is quick and lightweight when you need to transfer photos fast and share what you are seeing. In less than 2 minutes I can snap turn on my SiOnyx, link to phone and send to a friend what I am seeing. A+. I'd say for most situations I need this unit, ill be very happy. Only would've liked the ability to pull manual zoom for spotting in distance 200yrds. digital zoom seems to be a crop of full frame exposure so you cant get detail in the zoomed area if a branch reflects the IR back to the camera in the full frame without zoom. Make spotlight on IR and try to do several experiments and still tricky to get good focus at 200yrds on digital zoom. When you turn of digital zoom you can see better with exposure but my eyes struggle to identify objects at 200yrds since you are looking at less pixels on the screen. Detection is great (good screen refresh rate) but classification is tricky (pixel density).

Review.Contenu: Isn't it funny how you come across a couple of negative reviews. And it makes you think. Should I go for it and purchase it. I'm so glad I did go ahead and purchase the Aurora Pro. I've just got more interested in the night Sky. I can look up with the naked eye and see quite a few stars. With the Aurora Pro, the night sky comes alive with thousands of stars. Even when I get some street lighting bleeding into the viewer. You can darken or lighten your view. To keep most of the street lights out.The zoom is also good. I'm yet to use the app. All in all I'm happy with my purchase and would recommend the Aurora Pro.

Review.Titre: Loving my SiOnyx Pro . . .
Review.Contenu: I recently received the SiOnyx Pro night vision camera.  I am beyond impressed with its usefulness for my intended use.  For shooting the night sky, it does a great job of effectively gathering the low light required to record stars and the Milky Way.  When you consider the size, cost and the fine build quality of their cameras, it’s a definite recommendation from me.I had read some user reviews where there was disappointment when the camera was used in a completely dark environment.  Any device, like the SiOnyx Pro, needs some small degree of light – but not much – just enough for the camera to amplify what we can barely perceive to something truly visual.  With this in mind, it does what it claims to do very well!The camera has a few settings that allow you to take control of the camera -- allowing you to adjust the brightness of your recordings, manual focus, frame rate choices, and more.  It’s a simple devise to use.  And, the small size and light weight make it an easy camera to have with you at all times, allowing you to quickly capture those unexpected moments.  But beyond praise for the camera, their company has the best customer support EVER!  I required a fair bit of information about the Pro model vs. other cameras in their product line.  All questions were answered with astonishing speed.  It’s evident that they care about the user experience – taking pride in what they have developed, and what they offer.  Thanks for the great SiOnyx Pro.  And thanks too for helping me with your A+++ customer support which helped me with my purchasing decision.

Review.Titre: A Unique Customer Service Issue
Review.Contenu: I use your camera constantly and as an important part of my private investigator business.  Customer Service wanted me to return my camera in spite of it just needing a .25 plastic part.  I was a little scared and disappointed that I had to send the camera back when I could’ve easily fixed it myself with the correct part.  I just didn’t want to be without the camera for an extended time.  I sent the camera 2 day UPS and insured it for $800.  Sionyx replaced my camera, and threw in two batteries, and a charger cord.  They sent it back and it was in my hands within five days (two of which were Saturday and Sunday) from when I dropped it off at UPS.  All in all the experience was great and worked out fine.  I do wish Sionyx would keep some simple parts on hand, but this worked out great.  I use this camera constantly and it’s a great camera and clients love my video work product.  In fact I’m going to be adding a Sinoyx Pro to my stable of cameras and I have no concern that Sionyx will support their cameras and customers.  In my business, time truly is money, and I’m very pleased that Sionyx understands this and works hard to met customer requirements.  I’m looking forward to my new Sionyx Pro in the near future.  A special thank you to Bill (head of customer service) for taking the effort and extra time to support my needs.Tim Schmidt
